page.description: A default style can be defined in Web Project Properties that will be used by all components in your application.

section.description: To use the default project style, set the style in your component to *[xb:<ProjectStyle>]*.
You can change the component styles of the grids as a bulk operation, using the Edit|Bulk Operation|Global Replace of component styles dialog.

You can also set a component style to *[xb:<session:varname>]*. For example, if you set the style of a component to *[xb:<session:var1>]*, then at runtime if *[xb:session.var1]* is set to 'GrOlive', the component style will be set to 'GrOlive'. If the session variable does not exist, the style will be set to *[xb:<ProjectStyle>]*.

section.title: Video
section.description: This video shows how instead of hard coding the style used by each component in your project at Design Time, you can now set the style to *[xb:<ProjectStyle>]*. The style used by the component is set in Web Project Properties.

video.name: Setting Component Styles in one Place Using *[xb:<ProjectStyle>]*
